00001 /**
00002  * @file ccnslurp.c
00003  * Attempts pull everything in a branch of the ccn name hierarchy.
00004  *
00005  * A CCNx command-line utility.
00006  *
00007  * Copyright (C) 2008, 2009 Palo Alto Research Center, Inc.
00008  *
00009  * This work is free software; you can redistribute it and/or modify it under
00010  * the terms of the GNU General Public License version 2 as published by the
00011  * Free Software Foundation.
00012  * This work is distributed in the hope that it will be useful, but WITHOUT ANY
00013  * WARRANTY; without even the implied warranty of MERCHANTABILITY or
00014  * FITNESS FOR A PARTICULAR PURPOSE. See the GNU General Public License
00015  * for more details. You should have received a copy of the GNU General Public
00016  * License along with this program; if not, write to the
00017  * Free Software Foundation, Inc., 51 Franklin Street, Fifth Floor,
00018  * Boston, MA 02110-1301, USA.

00020 #include <errno.h>
00021 #include <stdio.h>
00022 #include <stdlib.h>
00023 #include <string.h>
00024 #include <ccn/bloom.h>
00025 #include <ccn/ccn.h>
00026 #include <ccn/charbuf.h>
00027 #include <ccn/uri.h>
00028 
00029 struct upcalldata {
00030     int magic; /* 856372 */
00031     long *counter;
00032     unsigned warn;
00033     int flags;
00034     int n_excl;
00035     struct ccn_charbuf **excl; /* Array of n_excl items */
00036 };
00037 #define EXCLUDE_LOW 1
00038 #define EXCLUDE_HIGH 2
00039 
00040 /* Prototypes */
00041 static int namecompare(const void *a, const void *b);
00042 static struct upcalldata *get_my_data(struct ccn_closure *selfp);
00043 static void append_bf_all(struct ccn_charbuf *c);
00044 static int express_my_interest(struct ccn *h,
00045                                struct ccn_closure *selfp,
00046                                struct ccn_charbuf *name);
00047 static struct ccn_closure *split_my_excludes(struct ccn_closure *selfp);
00048 static enum ccn_upcall_res incoming_content(struct ccn_closure *selfp,
00049                                             enum ccn_upcall_kind kind,
00050                                             struct ccn_upcall_info *);
00051 static struct ccn_charbuf *ccn_charbuf_duplicate(struct ccn_charbuf *);
00052 static void answer_passive(struct ccn_charbuf *templ);
00053 
00054 /* Global */
00055 static struct ccn_charbuf *passive_templ;
00056 static struct ccn_charbuf *
00057 create_passive_templ(void)
00058 {
00059     struct ccn_charbuf *templ = ccn_charbuf_create();
00060     ccn_charbuf_append_tt(templ, CCN_DTAG_Interest, CCN_DTAG);
00061     ccn_charbuf_append_tt(templ, CCN_DTAG_Name, CCN_DTAG);
00062     ccn_charbuf_append_closer(templ); /* </Name> */
00063     answer_passive(templ);
00064     ccn_charbuf_append_closer(templ); /* </Interest> */
00065     return(templ);
00066 }
00067 
00068 /*
00069  * Comparison operator for sorting the excl list with qsort.
00070  * For convenience, the items in the excl array are
00071  * charbufs containing ccnb-encoded Names of one component each.
00072  * (This is not the most efficient representation.)
00073  */
00074 static int /* for qsort */
00075 namecompare(const void *a, const void *b)
00076 {
00077     const struct ccn_charbuf *aa = *(const struct ccn_charbuf **)a;
00078     const struct ccn_charbuf *bb = *(const struct ccn_charbuf **)b;
00079     int ans = ccn_compare_names(aa->buf, aa->length, bb->buf, bb->length);
00080     if (ans == 0)
00081         fprintf(stderr, "wassat? %d\n", __LINE__);
00082     return (ans);
00083 }
00084 
00085 static struct upcalldata *get_my_data(struct ccn_closure *selfp)
00086 {
00087     struct upcalldata *data = selfp->data;
00088     if (data->magic != 856372) abort();
00089     return(data);
00090 }
00091 
00092 /*
00093  * This upcall gets called for each piece of incoming content that
00094  * matches one of our interests.  We need to issue a new interest that
00095  * excludes another component at the current level, and perhaps also
00096  * and interest to start exploring the next level.  Thus if the matched
00097  * interest is
00098  *   /a/b/c exclude {d,e,f,i,j,k}
00099  * and we get
00100  *   /a/b/c/g/h
00101  * we would issue a new interest
00102  *   /a/b/c exclude {d,e,f,g,i,j,k}
00103  * to continue exploring the current level, plus a simple interest
00104  *   /a/b/c/g
00105  * to start exploring the next level as well.
00106  *
00107  * This does end up fetching each piece of content multiple times, once for
00108  * each level in the name. The repeated requests will be answered from the local
00109  * content store, though, and so should not generate extra network traffic.
00110  * There is a lot of unanswerable interest generated, though.  
00111  *
00112  * To prevent the interests from becoming too huge, we may need to split them.
00113  * Thus if the first new interest above were deemed too large, we could instead
00114  * issue the two interests
00115  *   /a/b/c exclude {d,e,f,g,*}
00116  *   /a/b/c exclude {*,g,i,j,k}
00117  * where * stands for a Bloom filter that excludes anything.  Note the
00118  * repetiton of g to ensure that these two interests cover disjoint portions
00119  * of the hierarchy. We need to keep track of the endpoint conditions
00120  * as well as the excluded set in our upcall data.
00121  * When a split happens, we need a new closure to track it, as we do when
00122  * we start exploring a new level.
00123  */
00124 static enum ccn_upcall_res
00125 incoming_content(
00126     struct ccn_closure *selfp,
00127     enum ccn_upcall_kind kind,
00128     struct ccn_upcall_info *info)
00129 {
00130     struct ccn_charbuf *c = NULL;
00131     struct ccn_charbuf *comp = NULL;
00132     struct ccn_charbuf *uri = NULL;
00133     const unsigned char *ccnb = NULL;
00134     size_t ccnb_size = 0;
00135     struct ccn_indexbuf *comps = NULL;
00136     int matched_comps = 0;
00137     int res;
00138     int i;
00139     struct upcalldata *data = get_my_data(selfp);
00140     
00141     if (kind == CCN_UPCALL_FINAL) {
00142         for (i = 0; i < data->n_excl; i++)
00143             ccn_charbuf_destroy(&(data->excl[i]));
00144         if (data->excl != NULL)
00145             free(data->excl);
00146         free(data);
00147         free(selfp);
00148         return(0);
00149     }
00150     if (kind == CCN_UPCALL_INTEREST_TIMED_OUT)
00151         return(0);
00152     if (kind != CCN_UPCALL_CONTENT && kind != CCN_UPCALL_CONTENT_UNVERIFIED && kind != CCN_UPCALL_CONTENT_BAD)
00153         abort();
00154 
00155     ccnb = info->content_ccnb;
00156     ccnb_size = info->pco->offset[CCN_PCO_E];
00157     comps = info->content_comps;
00158     matched_comps = info->pi->prefix_comps;
00159     c = ccn_charbuf_create();
00160     uri = ccn_charbuf_create();
00161         
00162     if (matched_comps + 1 > comps->n) {
00163         ccn_uri_append(c, ccnb, ccnb_size, 1);
00164         fprintf(stderr, "How did this happen?  %s\n", ccn_charbuf_as_string(uri));
00165         exit(1);
00166     }
00167     
00168     if (kind == CCN_UPCALL_CONTENT_BAD) {
00169         ccn_uri_append(uri, ccnb, ccnb_size, 1);
00170         fprintf(stderr, "*** VERIFICATION FAILURE *** %s\n", ccn_charbuf_as_string(uri));
00171         uri->length = 0;
00172     }
00173     
00174     data->counter[0]++; /* Tell main that something new came in */
00175 
00176     /* Recover the same prefix as before */
00177     ccn_name_init(c);
00178     ccn_name_append_components(c, ccnb, comps->buf[0], comps->buf[matched_comps]);
00179     
00180     comp = ccn_charbuf_create();
00181     ccn_name_init(comp);
00182     if (matched_comps + 1 == comps->n) {
00183         /* Reconstruct the implicit ContentObject digest component */
00184         ccn_digest_ContentObject(ccnb, info->pco);
00185         ccn_name_append(comp, info->pco->digest, info->pco->digest_bytes);
00186     }
00187     else {
00188         ccn_name_append_components(comp, ccnb,
00189                                    comps->buf[matched_comps],
00190                                    comps->buf[matched_comps + 1]);
00191     }
00192     data->excl = realloc(data->excl, (data->n_excl + 1) * sizeof(data->excl[0]));
00193     data->excl[data->n_excl++] = comp;
00194     comp = NULL;
00195     qsort(data->excl, data->n_excl, sizeof(data->excl[0]), &namecompare);
00196     res = express_my_interest(info->h, selfp, c);
00197     if (res == -1) {
00198         struct ccn_closure *high = split_my_excludes(selfp);
00199         if (high == NULL) abort();
00200         express_my_interest(info->h, selfp, c);
00201         express_my_interest(info->h, high, c);
00202     }
00203     /* Explore the next level, if there is one. */
00204     if (matched_comps + 2 < comps->n) {
00205         struct upcalldata *newdat = NULL;
00206         struct ccn_closure *cl;
00207         newdat = calloc(1, sizeof(*newdat));
00208         newdat->magic = 856372;
00209         newdat->warn = 1492;
00210         newdat->counter = data->counter;
00211         newdat->flags = 0;
00212         newdat->n_excl = 0;
00213         newdat->excl = NULL;
00214         cl = calloc(1, sizeof(*cl));
00215         cl->p = &incoming_content;
00216         cl->data = newdat;
00217         ccn_name_init(c);
00218         ccn_name_append_components(c, ccnb,
00219                                    comps->buf[0],
00220                                    comps->buf[matched_comps + 1]);
00221         ccn_express_interest(info->h, c, cl, passive_templ);
00222     }
00223     else {
00224         res = ccn_uri_append(uri, info->content_ccnb, info->pco->offset[CCN_PCO_E], 1);
00225         if (res < 0)
00226             fprintf(stderr, "*** Error: ccnslurp line %d res=%d\n", __LINE__, res);
00227         else
00228             printf("%s\n", ccn_charbuf_as_string(uri));
00229     }
00230     ccn_charbuf_destroy(&c);
00231     ccn_charbuf_destroy(&uri);
00232     return(0);
00233 }
00234 
00235 /*
00236  * Append AnswerOriginKind=1 to partially constructed Interest, meaning
00237  * do not generate new content.
00238  */
00239 static void
00240 answer_passive(struct ccn_charbuf *templ)
00241 {
00242     ccn_charbuf_append_tt(templ, CCN_DTAG_AnswerOriginKind, CCN_DTAG);
00243     ccn_charbuf_append_tt(templ, 1, CCN_UDATA);
00244     ccn_charbuf_append(templ, "1", 1);
00245     ccn_charbuf_append_closer(templ); /* </AnswerOriginKind> */
00246 }
00247 
00248 /*
00249  * Construct and send a new interest that uses the exclusion list.
00250  * Return -1 if not sent because of packet size, 0 for success.
00251  */
00252 static int
00253 express_my_interest(struct ccn *h,
00254                     struct ccn_closure *selfp,
00255                     struct ccn_charbuf *name)
00256 {
00257     int ans;
00258     struct ccn_charbuf *templ = NULL;
00259     int i;
00260     struct upcalldata *data = get_my_data(selfp);
00261 
00262     templ = ccn_charbuf_create();
00263     ccn_charbuf_append_tt(templ, CCN_DTAG_Interest, CCN_DTAG);
00264     ccn_charbuf_append_tt(templ, CCN_DTAG_Name, CCN_DTAG);
00265     ccn_charbuf_append_closer(templ); /* </Name> */
00266     ccn_charbuf_append_tt(templ, CCN_DTAG_Exclude, CCN_DTAG);
00267     if ((data->flags & EXCLUDE_LOW) != 0)
00268         append_bf_all(templ);
00269     for (i = 0; i < data->n_excl; i++) {
00270         struct ccn_charbuf *comp = data->excl[i];
00271         if (comp->length < 4) abort();
00272         ccn_charbuf_append(templ, comp->buf + 1, comp->length - 2);
00273     }
00274     if ((data->flags & EXCLUDE_HIGH) != 0)
00275         append_bf_all(templ);
00276     ccn_charbuf_append_closer(templ); /* </Exclude> */
00277     answer_passive(templ);
00278     ccn_charbuf_append_closer(templ); /* </Interest> */
00279     if (templ->length + name->length > data->warn + 2) {
00280         fprintf(stderr, "*** Interest packet is %d bytes\n", (int)templ->length);
00281         data->warn = data->warn * 8 / 5;
00282     }
00283     if (templ->length + name->length > 1450 && data->n_excl > 3)
00284         ans = -1;
00285     else {
00286         ccn_express_interest(h, name, selfp, templ);
00287         ans = 0;
00288     }
00289     ccn_charbuf_destroy(&templ);
00290     return(ans);
00291 }
00292 
00293 /*
00294  * Build a new closure to handle the high half of the excludes, and modify the
00295  * old closure to handle the low half.
00296  */
00297 static struct ccn_closure *
00298 split_my_excludes(struct ccn_closure *selfp)
00299 {
00300     int i;
00301     int m;
00302     struct upcalldata *newdat = NULL;
00303     struct ccn_closure *cl;
00304     struct upcalldata *data = get_my_data(selfp);
00305     
00306     if (data->n_excl < 3)
00307         return NULL;
00308     m = data->n_excl / 2;
00309     newdat = calloc(1, sizeof(*newdat));
00310     newdat->magic = 856372;
00311     newdat->warn = 1492;
00312     newdat->counter = data->counter;
00313     newdat->n_excl = data->n_excl - m;
00314     newdat->excl = calloc(newdat->n_excl, sizeof(newdat->excl[0]));
00315     if (newdat->excl == NULL) {
00316         free(newdat);
00317         return(NULL);
00318     }
00319     newdat->excl[0] = ccn_charbuf_duplicate(data->excl[m]);
00320     newdat->flags = data->flags | EXCLUDE_LOW;
00321     for (i = 1; i < newdat->n_excl; i++) {
00322         newdat->excl[i] = data->excl[m + i];
00323         data->excl[m + i] = NULL;
00324     }
00325     data->n_excl = m + 1;
00326     data->flags |= EXCLUDE_HIGH;
00327     cl = calloc(1, sizeof(*cl));
00328     cl->p = &incoming_content;
00329     cl->data = newdat;
00330     return(cl);
00331 }
00332 
00333 /*
00334  * This appends a tagged, valid, fully-saturated Bloom filter, useful for
00335  * excluding everything between two 'fenceposts' in an Exclude construct.
00336  */
00337 static void
00338 append_bf_all(struct ccn_charbuf *c)
00339 {
00340     unsigned char bf_all[9] = { 3, 1, 'A', 0, 0, 0, 0, 0, 0xFF };
00341     const struct ccn_bloom_wire *b = ccn_bloom_validate_wire(bf_all, sizeof(bf_all));
00342     if (b == NULL) abort();
00343     ccn_charbuf_append_tt(c, CCN_DTAG_Bloom, CCN_DTAG);
00344     ccn_charbuf_append_tt(c, sizeof(bf_all), CCN_BLOB);
00345     ccn_charbuf_append(c, bf_all, sizeof(bf_all));
00346     ccn_charbuf_append_closer(c);
00347 }
00348 
00349 static struct ccn_charbuf *
00350 ccn_charbuf_duplicate(struct ccn_charbuf *c)
00351 {
00352     struct ccn_charbuf *ans = ccn_charbuf_create();
00353     ccn_charbuf_append(ans, c->buf, c->length);
00354     return(ans);
00355 }
00356 
00357 void
00358 usage(const char *prog)
00359 {
00360     fprintf(stderr,
00361             "%s URI\n"
00362             " Attempt to pull everything under given uri "
00363             " and print out names of found content to stdout\n", prog);
00364     exit(1);
00365 }
00366 
00367 int
00368 main(int argc, char **argv)
00369 {
00370     const char *progname = argv[0];
00371     struct ccn *ccn = NULL;
00372     struct ccn_charbuf *c = NULL;
00373     struct upcalldata *data = NULL;
00374     int i;
00375     long n;
00376     int res;
00377     long counter = 0;
00378     struct ccn_closure *cl = NULL;
00379     
00380     if (argv[1] == NULL || argv[2] != NULL)
00381         usage(argv[0]);
00382 
00383     passive_templ = create_passive_templ();
00384     c = ccn_charbuf_create();
00385     res = ccn_name_from_uri(c, argv[1]);
00386     if (res < 0) {
00387         fprintf(stderr, "%s: bad ccn URI: %s\n", progname, argv[1]);
00388         exit(1);
00389     }
00390         
00391     ccn = ccn_create();
00392     if (ccn_connect(ccn, NULL) == -1) {
00393         perror("Could not connect to ccnd");
00394         exit(1);
00395     }
00396     
00397     data = calloc(1, sizeof(*data));
00398     data->magic = 856372;
00399     data->warn = 1492;
00400     data->counter = &counter;
00401     cl = calloc(1, sizeof(*cl));
00402     cl->p = &incoming_content;
00403     cl->data = data;
00404     ccn_express_interest(ccn, c, cl, passive_templ);
00405     cl = NULL;
00406     data = NULL;
00407     ccn_charbuf_destroy(&c);
00408     for (i = 0;; i++) {
00409         n = counter;
00410         ccn_run(ccn, 1000); /* stop if we run dry for 1 sec */
00411         fflush(stdout);
00412         if (counter == n)
00413             break;
00414     }
00415     ccn_destroy(&ccn);
00416     ccn_charbuf_destroy(&passive_templ);
00417     exit(0);
00418 }
